com.devisubox.dvws.Runnable

Class TimeoutThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.devisubox.dvws.Runnable.TimeoutThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TimeoutThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    An alternative implementation of the Timer class, allowing to timeout multiple connections with one single thread.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean die
      When set to true, the thread will safely kill itself.

      The thread factory object.
      static long leeway
      Leeway allowed when calculating whether a connection has timed out.
      private java.util.Map<WebSocketConnection,java.lang.Long> timeoutConnections
      Map containing all of the connections to timeout, associated to the unix time in milliseconds in which to kill them.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextTimeout

        private org.javatuples.Pair<WebSocketConnection,java.lang.Long> getNextTimeout()

      • put

        public java.lang.Long put(WebSocketConnection connection,
                 long timeout)
        Sets a new timeout for a given connection. Putting another timeout for the same connection will cancel the current one.
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection that will be closed
        timeout - timeout in seconds
        Returns:
        the previous timeout for the connection, or null if it didn't have one

      • remove

        public java.lang.Long remove(WebSocketConnection connection)
        Sets a new timeout for a given connection. Putting another timeout for the same connection will cancel the current one.
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection that will be saved
        Returns:
        the timeout that had been set for the connection, or null if it didn't have one

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
